010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.lang.reflect.Array;
015
016/**
017 * This class defines various vector norms for calculating
018 * the magnitude of a vector and the distance between vectors.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2022/09/11
022 */
023public abstract class VectorNorm {
024        
025        private VectorNorm() {}
026
027        /**
028         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code double[]} vector under this norm.
029         * @param a a vector
030         * @return the magnitude of the vector
031         */
032        public abstract double magnitude(double[] a);
033        
034        /**
035         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code float[]} vector under this norm.
036         * @param a a vector
037         * @return the magnitude of the vector
038         */
039        public abstract double magnitude(float[] a);
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code int[]} vector under this norm.
043         * @param a a vector
044         * @return the magnitude of the vector
045         */
046        public abstract double magnitude(int[] a);
047
048        /**
049         * Returns the distance between two {@code double[]} vectors under this norm.
050         * @param a first vector
051         * @param b second vector
052         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
053         */
054        public abstract double distance(double[] a, double[] b);
055        
056        /**
057         * Returns the distance between two {@code float[]} vectors under this norm.
058         * @param a first vector
059         * @param b second vector
060         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
061         */
062        public abstract double distance(float[] a, float[] b);
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the distance between two {@code int[]} vectors under this norm.
066         * @param a first vector
067         * @param b second vector
068         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
069         */
070        public abstract double distance(int[] a, int[] b);
071
072        /**
073         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code double[]} vectors under this norm.
074         * @param a first vector
075         * @param b second vector
076         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
077         */
078        public abstract double distance2(double[] a, double[] b);
079        
080        /**
081         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code float[]} vectors under this norm.
082         * @param a first vector
083         * @param b second vector
084         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
085         */
086        public abstract double distance2(float[] a, float[] b);
087        
088        /**
089         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code int[]} vectors under this norm.
090         * @param a first vector
091         * @param b second vector
092         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
093         */
094        public abstract double distance2(int[] a, int[] b);
095
096        /**
097         * Returns a factor to scale magnitude and distance values 
098         * to the range of the vector components of dimensionality
099         * n. This is prim. used for scaling color distances (n = 3).
100         * E.g., if components are distributed in [0,255], the distances
101         * multiplied by this factor should again be in [0,255].
102         * 
103         * @param n dimensionality
104         * @return scale factor
105         */
106        public abstract double getScale(int n);
107
108        /**
109         * Enumeration type for {@link VectorNorm} to be used as
110         * parameter choice.
111         */
112        public enum NormType {
113                /** L1 (Manhattan) norm/distance (see {@link VectorNorm.L1}). */
114                L1 {@Override public VectorNorm getInstance() {return VectorNorm.L1.getInstance();}},           //(VectorNorm.L1.getInstance()),
115                /** L2 (Euclidean) norm/distance (see {@link VectorNorm.L2}). */
116                L2 {@Override public VectorNorm getInstance() {return VectorNorm.L2.getInstance();}},           //(VectorNorm.L2.getInstance()),
117                /** L-infinity (maximum) norm/distance (see {@link VectorNorm.Linf}). */
118                Linf {@Override public VectorNorm getInstance() {return VectorNorm.Linf.getInstance();}};       //(VectorNorm.Linf.getInstance());
119                                
120                /**
121                 * Returns the (singleton) {@link VectorNorm} instance associated with 
122                 * this specific {@link NormType}.
123                 * @return the {@link VectorNorm} instance
124                 */
125                public abstract VectorNorm getInstance();
126        }
127        
128        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
129        
130        private static void checkLengths(Object a, Object b) {
131                if (Array.getLength(a) != Array.getLength(b)) {
132                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors a, b must be of same length");
133                }
134        }
135                
136//      private static void checkLengths(double[] a, double[] b) {
137//              if (a.length != b.length) {
138//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
139//              }       
140//      }
141        
142//      private static void checkLengths(float[] a, float[] b) {
143//              if (a.length != b.length) {
144//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
145//              }       
146//      }
147        
148//      private static void checkLengths(int[] a, int[] b) {
149//              if (a.length != b.length) {
150//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
151//              }       
152//      }
153
154        //  concrete classes -----------------------------------------------
155
156        /**
157         * Implementation of the L1 vector norm (Manhattan norm/distance).
158         * This class defines no public constructor, use method
159         * {@link L1#getInstance()} to
160         * retrieve the associated (singleton) instance.
161         */
162        public static class L1 extends VectorNorm {
163                
164                private static final L1 instance = new L1();
165                private L1() {}
166                
167                /**
168                 * Returns an instance of this specific {@link VectorNorm} type.
169                 * @return a {@link VectorNorm} instance
170                 */
171                public static L1 getInstance() {
172                        return L1.instance;
173                }
174
175                @Override
176                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
177                        double sum = 0.0;
178                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
179                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
180                        }
181                        return sum;
182                }
183                
184                @Override
185                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
186                        double sum = 0.0;
187                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
188                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
189                        }
190                        return sum;
191                }
192
193                @Override
194                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
195                        long sum = 0;
196                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
197                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
198                        }
199                        return sum;
200                }
201
202                @Override
203                public double distance(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
204                        checkLengths(a, b);
205                        double sum = 0.0;
206                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
207                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
208                                sum = sum + Math.abs(d);
209                        }
210                        return sum;
211                }
212
213                @Override
214                public double distance(final int[] a, final int[] b) {
215                        checkLengths(a, b);
216                        int sum = 0;
217                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
218                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
219                        }
220                        return sum;
221                }
222
223                @Override
224                public double distance2(double[] a, double[] b) {
225                        double d = distance(a, b);
226                        return d * d;
227                }
228
229                public double distance2(int[] a, int[] b) {
230                        double d = distance(a, b);
231                        return d * d;
232                }
233
234                @Override
235                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
236                        double d = distance(a, b);
237                        return d * d;
238                }
239
240                @Override
241                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
242                        checkLengths(a, b);
243                        double sum = 0;
244                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
245                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
246                        }
247                        return sum;
248                }
249                
250                @Override
251                public double getScale(int n) {
252                        return 1.0 / n;
253                }
254
255        }
256
257        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
258
259        /**
260         * Implementation of the L2 vector norm (Euclidean norm/distance).
261         * This class defines no public constructor, use method
262         * {@link L2#getInstance()} to
263         * retrieve the associated (singleton) instance.
264         */
265        public static class L2 extends VectorNorm {
266                
267                private static final L2 instance = new L2();
268                private L2() {}
269                
270                /**
271                 * Returns an instance of this specific {@link VectorNorm} type.
272                 * @return a {@link VectorNorm} instance
273                 */
274                public static L2 getInstance() {
275                        return L2.instance;
276                }
277
278                @Override
279                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
280                        double sum = 0.0;
281                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
282                                sum = sum + a[i] * a[i];
283                        }
284                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
285                }
286                
287                @Override
288                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
289                        double sum = 0.0;
290                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
291                                sum = sum + Arithmetic.sqr((double) a[i]);
292                        }
293                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
294                }
295
296                @Override
297                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
298                        long sum = 0;
299                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
300                                sum = sum + a[i] * a[i];
301                        }
302                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
303                }
304
305                @Override
306                public double distance(double[] a, double[] b) {
307                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
308                }
309
310                @Override
311                public double distance2(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
312                        checkLengths(a, b);
313                        double sum = 0.0;
314                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
315                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
316                                sum = sum + d * d;
317                        }
318                        return sum;
319                }
320
321                @Override
322                public double distance(int[] a, int[] b) {
323                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
324                }
325
326                @Override
327                public double distance2(final int[] a, final int[] b) {
328                        checkLengths(a, b);
329                        int sum = 0;
330                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
331                                int d = a[i] - b[i];
332                                sum = sum + d * d;
333                        }
334                        return sum;
335                }
336
337                @Override
338                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
339                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
340                }
341                
342                @Override
343                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
344                        checkLengths(a, b);
345                        double sum = 0.0;
346                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
347                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
348                                sum = sum + d * d;
349                        }
350                        return sum;
351                }
352                
353                @Override
354                public double getScale(int n) {
355                        return Math.sqrt(1.0 / n);
356                }
357
358        }
359
360        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
361
362        /**
363         * Implementation of the L-infinity vector norm (maximum norm/distance).
364         * This class defines no public constructor, use method
365         * {@link Linf#getInstance()} to
366         * retrieve the associated (singleton) instance.
367         */
368        public static class Linf extends VectorNorm {
369                
370                private static final Linf instance = new Linf();
371                private Linf() {}
372                
373                /**
374                 * Returns an instance of this specific {@link VectorNorm} type.
375                 * @return a {@link VectorNorm} instance
376                 */
377                public static Linf getInstance() {
378                        return Linf.instance;
379                }
380
381                @Override
382                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
383                        double dmax = 0.0;
384                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
385                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
386                        }
387                        return dmax;
388                }
389                
390                @Override
391                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
392                        float dmax = 0.0f;
393                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
394                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
395                        }
396                        return dmax;
397                }
398
399                @Override
400                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
401                        int dmax = 0;
402                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
403                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
404                        }
405                        return dmax;
406                }
407
408                @Override
409                public double distance(double[] a, final double[] b) {
410                        checkLengths(a, b);
411                        double dmax = 0.0;
412                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
413                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
414                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(d));
415                        }
416                        return dmax;
417                }
418                
419                @Override
420                public double distance2(double[] a, double[] b) {
421                        return sqr(distance(a, b));
422                }
423
424                @Override
425                public double distance(int[] a, final int[] b) {
426                        checkLengths(a, b);
427                        int dmax = 0;
428                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
429                                int d = Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
430                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
431                        }
432                        return dmax;
433                }
434                
435                @Override
436                public double distance2(int[] a, int[] b) {
437                        double d = distance(a, b);
438                        return d * d;
439                }
440
441                @Override
442                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
443                        return sqr(distance(a, b));
444                }
445
446                @Override
447                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
448                        checkLengths(a, b);
449                        float dmax = 0;
450                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
451                                float d = Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
452                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
453                        }
454                        return dmax;
455                }
456                
457                @Override
458                public double getScale(int n) {
459                        return 1.0;
460                }
461
462        }
463
464}
465
